recipes.name: Baked Hawaiian Sandwiches
recipes.author: Niki Marotta
recipes.directions: Preheat oven to 400° and place a rack on the lower half of the oven. Place a half slice of ham, cheeses, and turkey on the bottom of each roll. Stir together butter, sugar, onion flakes, poppy seeds, and honey mustard. Brush over the top of each sandwich. Bake for 15 min. or until tops are golden brown and fillings are hot. Personal Note: Use parchment paper. Don’t need onion flakes and poppy seeds.

recipes.name: Brown Sugar Smokies
recipes.author: Niki Marotta
recipes.directions: Preheat oven to 350° Cut bacon into thirds. Cover (dip) bacon into brown sugar. Roll one sausage in each piece of bacon. Arrange on foil lined baking pan. Sprinkle a lot of brown sugar over top. Bake for 20 min. Pit on chafing dish or slow cooker to keep warm.

recipes.name: Cherry Punch
recipes.author: Niki Marotta
ingredients: 6 oz. can Frozen Lemonade Concentrate, thawed
6 oz. can Frozen Limeade Concentrate, thawed
recipes.directions: In a blender, combine concentrates and pineapple; cover and blend until smooth. Pour into a gallon- size container; stir in water. Store in the refrigerator. To serve, pour the mixture into a punch bowl; add cherry soda and ginger ale. Garnish with lemon and lime slices if desired. Yield: about 6 quarts

recipes.name: Indian Casserole
recipes.author: Niki Marotta
recipes.directions: Preheat oven to 350ºF. Lightly spray a 9x13x2-inch pan with cooking spray. Melt 2 Tbsp of butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add zucchini, squash and onion. Sauté for 10 minutes, or until tender. Add garlic and cook and additional 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir together cooked zucchini, squash, onion, corn, white cheddar cheese, sour cream, mayonnaise, eggs, salt and pepper. Stir in ½ cup of breadcrumbs and ½ cup of parmesan cheese. Spread mixture into prepared pan. Melt remaining 2 Tbsp butter. Combine melted butter, remaining breadcrumbs and parmesan cheese. Sprinkle over casserole. Bake uncovered for 45 to 50 minutes.

recipes.name: Swenson Burger Sauces
recipes.author: Cassie Abood
ingredients: 1 tablespoon white sugar (omit if using Miracle Whip)
recipes.directions: Combine all ingredients. Give at 1-2 hours to sit before eating.

recipes.name: Panera Kitchen Sink Cookies
recipes.author: Cassie Abood
ingredients: 1 tsp baking soda dissolved in 1 tbsp water
8 ounces semi-sweet or milk chocolate, chopped
5 ounces (2 bags) Werther's soft caramels, each cut in half
recipes.directions: Preheat oven to 350ºF. In a large mixing bowl, melt the butter and coconut oil with the brown sugar in the microwave. Stir and let mixture sit for 5 minutes. Whisk in the egg, the egg yolk, and the vanilla. Add the flour, baking soda water, and salt. Mix just until dough forms. Fold in the chocolate and pretzel crumbs. Toss the caramel pieces in a little bit of flour to prevent clumping, and mix them into the dough as well. Scoop ¼ cup of dough and roll it into a ball. Try to tuck the caramel pieces inside the dough or keep them on top. Place 6 balls of dough on each baking pan, leaving plenty of room for spreading. Sprinkle generously with flaked sea salt. Bake for 9 minutes, and then let cool completely on the baking pan.

recipes.name: Broccoli Casserole
recipes.author: Niki Marotta
ingredients: 1 Large Bunch Broccoli, 10 minutes cooked and drained
2 10 ounce cans Cream of Mushroom Soup
3 ounces Ritz Crackers, about 32 crackers, crushed
recipes.directions: Preheat oven to 350º.  Mix and put all non-topping ingredients into greased 13 by 9 inch pan.  Combine the crackers and butter.  Pour on top of mixture.  Bake for 35-45 minutes.

recipes.name: Amish Macaroni Salad
recipes.author: Niki Marotta
ingredients: 1 ½ Small Red Bell Peppers, seeded and chopped
¼ cup and 1 tsp. Prepared Yellow Mustard
1 tbsp. and ½ tsp. White Vinegar
recipes.directions: Bring a pot of lightly salted water to a boil.  Add macaroni, and cook for 8-10 minutes, until tender.  Drain, and set aside to cool.  In a large bowl, stir together the eggs, onion, celery, red pepper, and relish.  In a small bowl, stir together the mayo, miracle whip, mustard, sugar, vinegar, salt, and celery seed.  Pour over the vegetables, and stir in macaroni until well blended.  Cover and chill for at least 1 hour before serving.
